intro: Gonostemon hirsutus var. affinis, commonly known as the hairy gonostemon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which are often covered in fine, soft pubescence. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
